definitions: To remove a tap or spile from (a tree, cask, etc.).
To make available or accessible (a resource, potential, etc.) that was previously unused or hidden.
In card games, to make a tapped card or permanent ready for use again.
examples: They untap the maple trees after the sugaring season.
The company aims to untap new markets in Asia.
You can untap your creature at the beginning of your upkeep.
